sentences.sContent: The horsewhip-seller suddenly laughed and paid no attention to him.
sentences.sContent_eng: The horsewhip-seller suddenly laughed and paid no attention to him.
sentences.sCn: 卖马鞭的人忽然 笑了起来，理也不理他。

sentences.sContent: The horsewhip-seller appeared to be very angry.
sentences.sContent_eng: The horsewhip-seller appeared to be very angry.
sentences.sCn: 卖 马鞭的人显出很生气的样子。

sentences.sContent: The Expensive Horsewhip One day, a horsewhip-seller came to a market. His horsewhip didnt seem good.
sentences.sContent_eng: The Expensive Horsewhip One day, a horsewhip-seller came to a market. His horsewhip didnt seem good.
sentences.sCn: 昂贵的马鞭 有一天，市场上来了个卖马鞭的人。

sentences.sContent: These criminals deserve to be horse-whipped.
sentences.sCn: 这些罪犯应该用马鞭抽一顿。

trans.tranOther: A horsewhip is a long, thin piece of leather on the end of a short, stiff handle. It is used to train and control horses.
If someone horsewhips an animal or a person, they hit them several times with a horsewhip in order to hurt or punish them
